channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Chinese Court Is Said to Sentence Former News Executive to Prison
item.description: A Shanghai court found that Shen Hao, the former chairman of 21st Century Media, had demanded advertising purchases from businesses in exchange for positive news coverage.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: World Briefing: Thailand: 2 Sentenced to Death for Murders of British Tourists
item.description: The verdict follows an investigation and trial that were mired in controversy, including allegations of police incompetence, mishandling of evidence and torture of the suspects.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Fernande Grudet, Brothel Owner Known as Madame Claude, Dies at 92
item.description: In her heyday, Madame Claude presided over 500 women she called her swans; she claimed her clients included John F. Kennedy and the shah of Iran.
item.dc:creator: WILLIAM GRIMES
item.media:description: Fernande Grudet, better known as Madame Claude, in Paris before appearing on a television talk show in 1986.

item.title: World Briefing: Saudi Arabia: Condemned Maid Spared From Death Sentence
item.description: An appeals court has commuted a sentence of death by stoning for a Sri Lankan woman convicted of adultery.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Venezuela’s Departing Legislature Approves 13 New Justices
item.description: The legislature, dominated by President Nicolás Maduro’s party, voted in what critics called an attempt to stack the Supreme Court in the executive branch’s favor before an opposition-dominated Assembly took over.
item.dc:creator: PATRICIA TORRES and WILLIAM NEUMAN

item.title: World Briefing: Georgia: Prime Minister to Step Down
item.description: Irakli Garibashvili gave no specific reason when he resigned Wednesday in a surprise move less than a year before parliamentary elections.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Afghan Suicide Bomber Puts a Tragic End to a Life Spent Seeking Dignity
item.description: For advocates of gay rights in the military, Adrianna Vorderbruggen provided “a perfect narrative” of what it took to quietly endure and ultimately overcome discrimination in the ranks.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: ALAN SCHWARZ and ASHLEY SOUTHALL
item.media:description: An Air Force team with the coffin of Staff Sgt. Chester J. McBride, one of six service members killed in a bombing in Afghanistan.

item.title: Barring of British Muslim Family Flying to Disneyland Touches Nerve
item.description: The passengers said American officers at Gatwick Airport near London did not give a reason for denying them permission to board a flight to Los Angeles.
item.dc:creator: SEWELL CHAN

item.title: Conflict Between Turkey and Kurds Clouds the Life of a Michigan Cafe Owner
item.description: The Kurdish restaurateur faces deportation to Turkey for past links to a separatist group, but he could suffer brutal treatment when he gets there.
item.dc:creator: TAMAR LEWIN
item.media:credit: Gene D. Kaiser/South Bend Tribune, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Ibrahim Parlak talking to reporters at his Harbert, Mich., restaurant in June 2005. He spent 10 months in jail while the government tried to deport him to Turkey on terrorism charges.

item.title: Rights Group Says Russia May Have ‘Directly Attacked Civilians’ in Syria
item.description: Moscow has denied findings by Amnesty International that at least 200 civilians have been killed in Syria by Russian airstrikes over a two-month period.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: KAREN ZRAICK
item.media:description: Mourners gathered on Nov. 29 over the bodies of victims of what activists said were airstrikes carried by the Russian air force on a market in the town of Ariha, Syria.

item.title: Who Runs Algeria? Many Doubt It’s Ailing President Abdelaziz Bouteflika
item.description: After the president’s two strokes in recent years, his condition is so uncertain that a group of prominent associates has demanded to see him.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: CARLOTTA GALL
item.media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
item.media:description: A mural commemorating the war of independence against France in Algiers. After two strokes in recent years, the condition of President Abdelaziz Bouteflika is in question.

item.title: Saudi-Led War in Yemen Frays Ties With the U.S.
item.description: A U.N. session intended to draw attention to the dire effects of the war also raised questions about potential crimes committed by a Saudi-led military offensive that the Pentagon actively supports.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Spain’s 2 Top Political Leaders Meet After Inconclusive Elections
item.description: Despite talks of a coalition, Pedro Sánchez, the leader of the Socialists, said his party would not allow Mariano Rajoy or his conservative Popular Party to stay in government.
item.dc:creator: RAPHAEL MINDER
item.media:description: Pedro Sánchez, left, the leader of Spain's main opposition party, met with Mariano Rajoy, the prime minister, on Wednesday in Madrid.

item.title: World Briefing: Canada May Miss Goal to Admit 10,000 Refugees by Year’s End
item.description: At least 10,000 Syrian refugees will be “certified” as permanent residents of Canada by year’s end but may not reach Canadian soil by then, the immigration minister said.
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN

item.title: Suspicions Mount That Ailing President Abdelaziz Bouteflika Is No Longer Running Algeria
item.description: After two strokes in recent years, the condition of President Abdelaziz Bouteflika is so uncertain that a group of prominent associates has demanded to see him.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: CARLOTTA GALL
item.media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
item.media:description: A mural commemorating the war of independence against France in Algiers. After two strokes in recent years, the condition of President Abdelaziz Bouteflika is in question.

item.title: Tensions Rise Over U.S. Visa Measure That Could Affect Iran Nuclear Accord
item.description: Lawmakers behind the new limit on visa-free travel, which Iran calls an obstacle to the nuclear pact, warned the White House against exempting Iran.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: Mohammad Javad Zarif, the Iranian foreign minister, after speaking to Iran's Parliament in Tehran in July. He said the new restrictions would be tantamount to a breach of the nuclear deal.

item.title: In Brazil, 99Taxis Start-Up Jockeys to Stay Ahead of Uber
item.description: A new fund-raising round could be a huge lift for the company, based in São Paulo, which has more than twice the market share of Uber.
item.dc:creator: VINOD SREEHARSHA
item.media:description: Taxis parked in São Paulo during a protest against Uber.

item.title: Two Israeli Jews Stabbed, One Fatally, by Two Palestinians in Jerusalem
item.description: The two assailants died after being shot by the police, and a third Israeli civilian died hours later, apparently after he was hit by police fire, the police said.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Israeli forensic experts covering the body of a Palestinian man who was shot dead after a reported stabbing in Jerusalem on Wednesday.

item.title: Israeli Veterans’ Criticism of West Bank Occupation Incites Furor
item.description: A group called Breaking the Silence is at the center of a debate that is exposing Israel’s divisions over its values and the nature of its democracy.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Employees at the offices of Breaking the Silence in Tel Aviv in December. By publishing the testimonies of soldiers, mostly anonymously, the organization highlights what it views as the corrosive nature of the occupation of the West Bank on Israeli society.

item.title: China Landslide: Man Pulled Alive From Shenzhen Debris After 67 Hours
item.description: A young migrant worker rescued Wednesday is the only person saved from a collapsed factory in Shenzhen, China.
item.dc:creator: KATIE ROGERS
item.media:description: A survivor is carried out on a stretcher after spending more than 60 hours trapped following a landslide that engulfed dozens of buildings in Shenzhen, China.
